position: Lead PCB/Flex Process Engineer - Assembly and Manufacturing
title: Lead PCB/Flex Process Engineer - Assembly and Manufacturing
description:
Rigetti Computing is developing cloud-deployed quantum computers to solve humanity’s most pressing and valuable problems. We are a highly diverse and interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers working at the cutting edge of technology in a mission-driven entrepreneurial environment. We believe that bringing together teams from various cultures, educational backgrounds, and technical disciplines helps them to see things from more points of view and to make great products that change the world for the better.

As a PCB/Flex Process Engineer -  Assembly and Manufacturing on the Hardware team at Rigetti Computing, you will develop cutting-edge solutions to enable the scaling of quantum computers in complexity to a larger number of qubits while increasing performance, focusing on developing high-density signal delivery leveraging flex and rigid PCBs, and assembly solutions that enable microwave RF signaling to our quantum devices at cryogenic temperatures. You will be working closely with a team of electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, and physicists, as well as outside component suppliers, to define component & assembly processes that meet these scaling & performance challenges. You will guide supplier process development and integrate components, design test protocols and integrate those components into the R&D and production release workflows. 

The ideal candidate brings experience working with suppliers on the materials & processes used in PCBs, Flexible Electronics, and Assembly of components, preferably using innovative materials. You enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary environment, and you excel at translating functional requirements into prototypes and then guiding those products through development into low-volume manufacturing.  You are able to identify requirements and constraints and manage effective test programs that navigate these inputs. You are a strong communicator who keeps stakeholders informed and involved.

title: Automation Engineer, Manufacturing and Supply Chain Operations
description:
Bleximo develops hardware and technologies for the emergent quantum computing industry. We design and manufacture first-generation practical quantum computing systems, which address complex problems in materials science, machine learning, pharmacology, finance, defense, and more. Our systems utilize cryogenic superconducting qubits and microwave integrated circuit technology; their creation requires close multidisciplinary collaboration among Bleximo's scientists and engineers, as well as academic and corporate clients.
We prioritize candidates who bring positive energy and exceptional skills to the Bleximo team. As a rapidly growing company with a highly creative and fast-paced work environment, we value team members who habitually orient themselves to the right problems and offer thoughtful solutions. Social aptitude and a willingness to learn unfamiliar technical topics are a must.
The Mechanical & Cryo Team spearheads the overall design and deployment of superconducting quantum computing systems; in particular, it is responsible for the seamless integration of quantum processors, wiring, and OEM microwave devices into complete systems. You will contribute to all aspects of the development, manufacturing, and deployment of these systems. The cryogenic, mechanical, and microwave components for these complex systems are primarily custom designed by us. They require exceptional manufacturing quality and must carefully match to their design specifications.
As a Automation Engineer for Manufacturing and Supply Chain Operations in the Mechanical & Cryo Team, you will also work closely with our Microfabrication, Processor, and Quantum Test & Measurement teams to ensure that our systems can be built and deployed on-time and on-budget. This hands-on position will require understanding the system's design and operation principles, as well as the functionality of individual parts and components. Creativity, attention to detail, and effective communication skills are the keys to your success at Bleximo.
Responsibilities
Optimize manufacturing and procurement schedules, supporting the Mechanical & Cryo Team's hardware design, documentation, manufacturing, assembly integration, testing, and quality processes.
Streamline sensitive manufacturing workflows using built-in automations and APIs from Airtable, Confluence, Jira, Google Suite, Slack, Zapier, and more.
Improve and maintain a relational database that acts as a single source of truth for manufacturing data across the entire company.
Process POs and communicate with vendors in our manufacturing network.
Identify data silos and operational challenges across teams, propose effective solutions that contribute to the vision of a single source of truth across the entire company, and work to implement them.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a STEM discipline or related field
3+ years professional experience with quantitative analysis and modeling in Python, SQL, JavaScript, Airtable, or similar tools
Excellent communication skills well-suited for collaboration with a diverse team of scientists and engineers
Keen attention to detail
Able to work primarily onsite from our Berkeley headquarters with some remote work opportunities
Occasional travel across the Bay Area as needed to maintain vendor and collaborator relationships
Bonus Qualifications
Master's Degree in an engineering discipline
Professional experience in a hardware-intensive field (aerospace, consumer hardware, medical devices, contract manufacturing, etc)
Startup experience
Advanced Airtable or database proficiencies
Exposure to international quality management systems standards like ISO:9001
Familiarity with collaboration and productivity platforms like Atlassian suite tools and Google suite tools (or similar)
Advanced knowledge of scripting languages (Python, JavaScript, and REST APIs preferred)
Benefits:
Competitive compensation
Stock options
100% employer-covered Kaiser Silver health plan, including full coverage for dependents
Option for Kaiser Gold or Blue Shield PPO upgrade
Vision and dental coverage
401(k) plan
Life insurance
Dog-friendly workplace
Location:
Bleximo is located in Berkeley CA. Our HQ is easily accessible via the Ashby freeway exit or the Ashby BART station + AC Transit Line 36. Our neighborhood is extremely walk and bike friendly (https://www.walkscore.com/score/94710), with nearby restaurants, cafes, stores, and community spaces.
Bleximo (“The Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. Creating an inclusive and professional environment where employees feel comfortable, safe, and free from inappropriate and disrespectful conduct is one of the Company's core values. The Company does not discriminate against (in any aspect of employment, including, but not limited to recruiting and hiring, job assignment, compensation, opportunities for advancement, promotion, transfers, evaluation, benefits, training, discipline, and termination), nor does it tolerate harassment by any person, including, but not limited to, co-workers, managers, and third parties, on the basis of race, color, religion (including, but not necessarily limited to, religious creed, dress, and grooming practices), citizenship, marital status, age (40 and older), national origin, ancestry, mental or physical disability (including, but not limited to, HIV and AIDS disabilities), genetic information, medical condition (as defined by applicable law and including cancer), U.S. military (state and federal) and veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex, gender, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical condition), or any other characteristics protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws (“protected characteristics” or “protected categories”). The Company also prohibits discrimination and harassment based on the perception that anyone falls within one of these protected categories or is associated with a person who is or is perceived to be in one of these protected categories. These prohibitions apply in the workplace, on business trips, during business meetings, at business-related social events, and at any other location where a Company-sponsored event takes place.

title: Marketing Events Manager (Fixed Term)
description:
Ready to join the AQ era?
SandboxAQ is solving challenging problems with AI + Quantum for positive impact. We partner with global leaders in government, academia, and the private sector to identify applications that would benefit from quantum-based applications to current and future commercial challenges. We engage with customers early and throughout the development process to improve market fit.
Our team's unique approach enables cross-pollination across a diverse range of fields, from physics, computer science, neuroscience, mathematics, cryptography, natural sciences and more! Our success comes from coalescing diverse talent to create an environment where experimental thinking and collaboration yield breakthrough AI + Quantum solutions. Join a culture where thought leadership, diverse talent, employee engagement, and technological impact will create the next tech uproar.
We are deeply committed to education as a means to advance quantum solutions and computing initiatives. We invest in future talent through internship programs, research papers, developer tools, textbooks, educational talks/events and partnerships with universities/talent hubs to attract multi-disciplinary talent. Our hope is to inspire people from all walks of life to be prepared for the quantum era and encourage a path in STEM.
Are you passionate about event marketing? At SandboxAQ we deliver enterprise SaaS solutions at the nexus of quantum technology and AI. Based in Palo Alto, the inspiration for Sandbox AQ and some of the team originated at Alphabet Inc, and in 2022 Sandbox AQ launched as an independent, venture-backed company.
In the tech and data intelligence worlds, a sandbox is where innovation is born. It's a place where the brightest free-thinking minds from across disciplines come together to reimagine what's possible. We have a collaborative environment where the whole is infinitely greater than the sum of the parts.
How you will make an impact:
Manage planning and execution for conferences, shows, and other events providing strategic oversight and aligning event plan to company strategy
Manage webcasts and virtual events
Manage pre- and post-event marketing and communications and own event lead generation targets
Manage budgeting and payments for tradeshows and sponsorships
Lead all event planning logistics, including venue selection, space configuration, booth production, production schedule, invitations, agenda, catering, A/V, speaker slides and materials, and marketing materials
Coordinate and act as primary interface with all vendors such as trade show booth design companies, hotels, caterers, A/V and webcast vendors, and shipping POCs
Edit event marketing communications materials for accuracy, clarity, brevity, and logic
Organize pre-event meetings for Sandbox AQ teams and publish event plan for each event to brief customer-facing team and participants
Work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment, and manage timeline to meet tight deadlines
It'd be great if you also had these:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing, or Hospitality
5+ years' experience in the development of event and tradeshow strategy, planning and logistics
Demonstrated management of detailed fiscal budgets for tradeshows and corporate events
Strong understanding of technical material
Superior writing, editing and verbal communications skills
Excellent attention to detail
High-level organizational and time management skills
Ability to work independently as a self-starter
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Expertise in using MS Office (Adobe Marketo is a plus!)
SandboxAQ welcomes all.
We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where we have zero tolerance for discrimination. We invest in our employees' personal and professional growth. Once you work with us, you can't go back to normalcy because great breakthroughs come from great teams and we are the best in quantum technology.
We offer competitive salaries, stock options depending on employment type, education stipends, medical/dental/vision, family planning/fertility, PTO (summer and winter breaks), financial wellness resources, 401(k) plans, and more.

description:
About us:
D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software, and services and is the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling.

D-Wave’s quantum computers and quantum cloud services are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. We have also appeared in Time Magazine, MIT Technology Review, Forbes, INC Magazine and Wired.

As of August 8, 2022, our organization is a publicly traded quantum computing company, trading on the NYSE as ($QBTS).

About the role:
To meet our goals, we are seeking a Technical Writer - Compliance to join our software, algorithms, and cloud services team in Burnaby, BC, to help document internal processes required for compliance certification and IT security best practices.
As a Technical Writer - Compliance, you will work with internal teams to obtain an in-depth understanding of IT security requirements and best practices and to translate them into policies, procedures, and work instructions for internal use. You understand the documentation needs for compliance certification, and will work with internal teams to identify gaps, create templates and define editorial standards, develop and communicate standards for contributors, write content, review and edit content by others, and manage change and versioning to ensure documentation is accurate and up to date.
What you'll do:
Write and/or edit user-friendly technical documents for internal use, including policies, procedures, and work instructions
Provide expertise in the creation of appropriate documentation needed to meet and maintain regulatory and compliance requirements, including SOC 1 Type II, SOC 2, and GDPR
Create and maintain templates in Microsoft Word to ensure ease of use and consistent format.
Work with business teams to gather requirements and data
Develop outlines and drafts for review and approval by developers, IT professionals, and business leadership, and other stakeholders, ensuring that final documents meet applicable industry and compliance standards
Monitor changes to the compliance and regulatory landscape as it pertains to the organization and understand how changes will affect internal documentation
Consult relevant information sources to obtain background information and ensure standards governing technical-documentation deliverables are applied
Manage the tracking and control of technical documents to ensure content is accurate and up to date, and that the appropriate versions are active
Assist in compliance audits by working with internal teams and external assessors and authorities
What you'll bring:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
5+ years of experience working as a technical writer
2+ years of experience developing internal process documentation to support third-party compliance and/or certification requirements
Exceptionally clear written and verbal communication skills
Ability to deliver high-quality content with attention to detail
Advanced abilities in Microsoft Word (template creation and maintenance)
Ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable for end users
Experience working in many industries, learning new domains fast, and adding value fast
Ability to work with cross-functional internal stakeholders and influence them to deliver
Excellent organizational skills
Bonus qualifications:
Professional certification or formal training in one or more of the following: IT Security, Compliance, Risk Management
Relevant experience in organizations that are compliant with SOC2, ISO, or similar standards
Experience documenting hardware installation and maintenance procedures
Additional information:
We celebrate diverse perspectives to drive innovation in our pursuit. Our employees range from distinguished domain experts with decades of experience in their respective fields, to bright and motivated graduates eager to make their mark.
Our diverse and innovative team will make you feel appreciated, supported and empower your career growth at D-Wave.

No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.

title: Software Engineering Director
description:
At Atom Computing, we’re building quantum computers with atomic arrays of optically-trapped neutral atoms, empowering researchers and companies to achieve unprecedented breakthroughs. Join an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals to advance the state of the art in quantum technologies that will transform computing performance.
 Atom Computing is looking for a Software Engineering Director to grow and manage our software engineering team and lead all aspects of our software stack development.  Our quantum computing system requires a significant amount of software such as drivers to control hardware devices such as lasers, motors, and cameras, an operating system responsible for managing system resources and scheduling jobs, developer platform and user interfaces for scientists, researchers, engineers, and third-party companies to program quantum algorithms and applications for a broad range of use cases.  While software development and people management experience are a must, a background in physics is not necessary as long as you are willing to learn on the job.

description:
Introduction
IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Q Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The right person for this job will have an opinion of the proper shape of a quantum software stack. You might come from an applications/end-user perspective or from a lower-level compiler and instrument control perspective. But, you have been thinking about how those top-level pieces should be glued and connected to the lower-level components. We are building a new stack for a new domain - there are no models to follow - you will have to think about what the right layers are and how to interface between them. In particular, a first task for your team is how to expose and interface with classical compute resources in the Qiskit Runtime to improve system performance. You will work with application developers, quantum information scientists, and quantum control engineers, as well as the Qiskit core team.

This position can be located Anywhere in the USA.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Working knowledge of python programming, with experience building large software projects in at least one programming language
Some exposure across the quantum computing stack (applications, compilers, circuits, algorithms, and pulses) with deep knowledge of at least one of those areas
Strong communication and teamwork skills



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Deep knowledge of python
Prior open source software contributions
Comfortable with collaborate software methodologies (code review, design docs, etc.)

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science.

IBM is seeking a Technical Product Manager to lead, build and incubate new products based on highly promising emerging technologies from IBM Research in hybrid cloud compute and data platforms, quantum computing, AI, and automation.

You should be an experienced Cloud Software Product Manager to help create and bring to users foundational new capabilities to accelerate scientific discovery through the digital application of the scientific method focused on accelerating discovery of new materials and drugs.

IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We're proudly supported by high-quality investors like GV (Google Ventures), New Enterprise Associates (NEA), Amazon, Samsung, Bosch, HP, Airbus, and more.
We are looking for a Staff Mechanical Engineer. As a Staff Mechanical Engineer, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with optical engineers to develop ultra high precision beam shaping and steering hardware
Define, design, and develop precision and miniature components and mechanical assemblies
Define, design and develop opto-mechanical modules that incorporate components such as complex lenses, waveplates, and acousto-optics modulators
Develop fixtures and processes for precision opto-mechanical assembly

Montana Instruments is the premier cryogenics company accelerating quantum discovery. We build market-leading systems for our partners in the quantum journey and have enjoyed 10+ years of validated success.

Montana Instruments, a growing high-tech Company in Bozeman, Montana, is seeking a Senior Project Manager. The Senior Project Manager is responsible for developing the project scope, cost estimates, timelines, and management of complex Systems, Process, Product, or other business projects.
You will interface with all functions necessary to bring highly reliable, best in class, products to market. The primary focus of this position is to plan, facilitate and integrate the development of products. You will be responsible for managing and communicating progress against the established cost, schedule and product experience goals to management and stakeholders. This position is more than tracking schedules and maintaining issue lists. You will be an integral part of the development team, helping the team to select system architecture, work through issues and solve problems. This will require taking a systems integration approach to product development, ensuring that all parts are thoroughly integrated, tested and proven to meet the product requirements.
To be successful you will be a high performer with a rare and specific skill set who will thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment. Your ability to think critically, lead through intellect, deliver quickly, and to partner across a wide variety of functions to drive change in a complex setting will be essential to the rollout of our offerings to the market.

Develops project scope, cost estimates, human resource requirements, work plans, time schedules, communication plans, and makes work assignments to meet project or program objectives.

Provides leadership and direction to the functional team so that tasks and activities are coordinated for project scope control, project cost, and project schedule.
Coordinate all activities in the project including but not limited to; R&D, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Product Management.
Maintain and improve the company’s Product Development standard operating procedures.
Develops and maintains records, prepares reports, and composes correspondence relative to the work.

Work with internal clients to understand their needs and assess business processes and workflows.
Assist day-to-day operational aspects of project and scope.
Minimize risk and formulate contingency plans.
Resolve and/or escalate issues in a timely fashion.
Flexibility to work extended hours when needed

The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering strongly preferred. Thorough knowledge of Project Management principles, concepts and practices.

Strong communication skills, team work and interpersonal skills.

Excellent organizational skills with a commitment to meeting deadlines and expectations while ensuring overall compliance and quality of delivery.

Results-driven
Courageous
Team-first
We want to create an environment where champions are enabled in every area of the company. We want to hire people who have the desire and potential to do great things. We want to give people the freedom and responsibility to become champions as part of a professional team.
About Bozeman:
Montana Instruments is located in Bozeman, Montana, a vibrant town at the foot of the Bridger Mountains within an hour of three great ski hills, several world-class fly-fishing rivers, and plenty of adventure (Yellowstone National Park is just 90 minutes south).
Bozeman is Montana’s biggest tech hub and home to quantum companies like Teledyne, Flir, and ADVR Incorporated, as well as Spectrum Lab and the Borys Lab at Montana State University. position: Staff Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer
location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
title: Staff Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Are you interested in exploring a career in the cutting edge of IC circuit design? You'll leverage your current experience against our training and your team's wealth of knowledge with the goal of designing Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL) and superconducting devices in a highly collaborative team environment.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Capabilities division is a leader in the development and manufacture of next generation high-performance computing. Superconducting electronics form the core of our technology, with development thrusts in both quantum and classical logic. Our quantum computing activities include the development of superconducting devices for both quantum annealing and gate-model quantum computation. Our classical computing activities focus on energy-efficient computation using our patented superconducting digital logic technology, RQL. With a well-established impressive performance this technology is appealing for a variety of immediate applications and future research possibilities at a time when Moore’s law is dramatically slowing. You’ll work in a fast-paced team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make these design solutions a reality.
We are seeking motivated Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit (IC) Design Engineers to join our team in design and layout of custom digital superconducting circuits. You will use your skills as a lead IC designer while learning about superconducting circuit design. Tasks will include schematic capture, circuit simulation, circuit layout, physical verification (LVS, DRC), and parasitic extraction for a variety of superconducting circuits. The right candidate will be comfortable in a dynamic environment with rapidly developing technologies and tools. The candidate must have experience in custom circuit design, preferably with Cadence Virtuoso. Experience with modeling circuit performance using Spice tools or ADE/Spectre, and/or experience with EM software such as HFSS, Momentum, Clarity or CST is highly desirable. Familiarity with quantum information is a plus. The candidate must be able to take a design from concept through modeling, layout and verification and create a test plan based on circuit requirements. Strong written and oral communication skills are required.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field with 14 years of experience in either Analog, Digital or Mixed Signal Circuit design (12 years with MS or 9 years with a PhD)
Solid understanding of circuit design theory; extensive hands-on custom circuit design experience
Working knowledge of the IC design flow including schematic capture, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS)
Proficiency with modern IC design tools (preferably Cadence Virtuoso) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and custom layout; physical verification using Assura or Calibre
Ability to oversee all phases of IC design from specification, to design and tapeout
Good understanding of IC manufacturing and testing processes
Experience with product validation and testing
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and milestones according to program schedule
Excellent communication skills, able to efficiently disseminate information to leadership and respective working group
Able to obtain and maintain a Top-Secret clearance per business requirements. US Citizenship is a requirement for this.
Preferred Qualifications:
Design chip lead with a proven record of successful tapeouts; ability to design sub-blocks and perform chip level integration
Create and maintain chip design schedule, and meet tight deadlines in accordance with the overall program schedule
Create test plans, supervise product testing, and collaborate with the test team
Microwave engineering background; solid understanding of transmission line theory and impedance matching techniques
Electromagnetic modeling background with commercial tools, such as HFSS, CST, Clarity
Understanding of combinatorial and sequential logic; experience with custom logic gates, latches, flip-flops, clock synthesis and distribution and related issues
Programming experience using an objected oriented language like Python or C++
Scripting experience with SKILL
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics
Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements
Familiar with the engineering product life cycle model
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance

title: Director of Manufacturing
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution. 
We are looking for a Manufacturing Director to stand up our Seattle production & data center facility and team. This leader will own Production and Data Center operations in Seattle, including all shop floor (MES) systems and flows. This leader will partner with Product and Test Engineering to develop assembly processes, manufacturing documentation, and quality systems for our initial production computers. To enable effective product development and transfer to manufacturing, critical NPI (new product introduction) business processes, checklists, and tools must be deployed and integrated. Together with R&D, Engineering and Supply Chain Management, you will lead a cross-functional team whose mission is to commercialize IonQ products on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve very complex problems. 
Responsibilities: 
Lead implementation of our new Seattle Manufacturing and Data Center operations, including associated project management
Build and guide a world class operations team, delivering operational insights, practices and tools to achieve business objectives
Lead and manage the quantum computer system level production assembly, production test operations, and fulfillment per requirements from Planning
Develop core competencies and best practices for in-house manufacturing engineering and test execution, including assembly process design and implementation, and strategic partner-based assemblies (as needed)
Evaluate IonQ’s needs and design an organization with capabilities and staffing to accomplish our business objectives
Develop and maintain a production model to respond to fluctuating Demand, Supply, and Quality/Improvement needs
Hire and retain top talent to grow the manufacturing capability at a new site
Partner with stakeholders to design the manufacturing and data center facility, and monitor/modify the construction (as needed)
Partner with Engineering stakeholders including Test Development and Opto-Mechanical Design to provide DFM requirements and prove-in for manufacturing
Be the Manufacturing owner for our PLM system
Drive continuous improvement activities to achieve business objectives and operational excellence
Implement / oversee equipment calibration and maintenance programs 
Formulate the right metrics and definitions of success to drive quality, effectiveness, efficiency, cost and timelines
Select and implement an MES (Manufacturing Execution System)
Partner cross-functionally with other leaders to develop key business processes, and implement systems and tools to enable effective and efficient collaboration across departments, including PDLC, PLM, PNR, ECO, QRB and MRB process
Bring-up in-line quality assurance to meet industry standards (eg TL9k)
Develop safety guidelines, train and enforce the protocols with employees
You’d be a Good Fit with: 
7+ years of leadership experience in high-tech, complex systems engineering and manufacturing
5+ years of management experience of cross-functional teams including manufacturing, process engineering, and quality
Demonstrated ability to recruit and retain top talent, both experienced and new college graduates
Experience transforming R&D prototypes into highly-reliable, commercial products
Experience with data collection and analysis
Experience with formal quality and continuous improvement systems/process 
Experience with supply chain sourcing and partnership for critical development and innovation
Ability to collaborate closely with the technical, professional and facilities teams
Strong hands-on attitude and ability to spend significant time “on the floor” with the team, being involved at the detail level. If remote to our R&D site(s), a reasonable amount of travel will be required to establish teams and processes.
Best-in-class cross-functional communication & presentation skills
You’d be a Great Fit with: 
Demonstrated experience in implementation or configuration of PDM systems
Demonstrated experience in implementation or configuration of MES / Shop Flow systems
Experience with Operations or Production Management
Experience with complex optical systems and lasers
Experience with free-space optical systems and fiber optics
Experience with HVAC systems
Demonstrated ability to manage and conduct knowledge transfer between sites, identifying and implementing best practices
Detailed knowledge and experience of Systems Engineering principles and PDLC (Product Development Lifecycle) processes
Education: 
Bachelor’s degree or above in Engineering or Science
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a five-minute walk from the Metro. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We are looking for Systems Engineers (multiple levels) with experience in leading and supporting multi-disciplined engineering teams through the product development lifecycle. As a member of the Engineering organization, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems. 
In this role you will develop requirements, model architectures, complete trade studies, define verification criteria, and complete system analyses for our current and next generation of quantum computers.
Responsibilities: 
Lead/Support development teams in the System Engineering lifecycle for quantum computing programs/projects including requirements development, architecture decomposition, system analyses (reliability, maintainability, etc.), integration and test planning, and system verification
Translate stakeholder and product requirements into design specifications
Perform operational and functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition for first of a kind prototypes as well as production quantum computing systems  
Support program & executive leadership through the identification of risk and risk mitigation plans
Support technical publications of system requirements documents, interface control documents, verification procedures and reports
Hands-on modeling, design, integration, test, and verification support of our quantum computers across lab facilities requiring skills in algorithms, software, hardware, and networking
You’d be a good fit with: 
B.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
A breadth of deep understanding, backed by experience, of the principles, concepts, and methods of systems engineering such as concept development, requirement definition, functional decomposition and allocation, design solution definition, implementation, integration, verification and validation, qualification, commissioning, and operations
Experience with system performance definition through requirements analysis using modeling tools
Understanding of industry best practices in requirements creation, decomposition, and management
Demonstrated technical depth with one or more of the following subject areas and/or subsystems:
Trapped ion systems
AMO physics
Ultra-high vacuum systems
Chip scale device design, packaging, and fabrication – semiconductor level modules and systems
Optics and lasers (NIR and visible, pulsed and CW), precision micro- and bulk- optics, free space and fiber, optical sensors
Integrated photonic components (active and passive)
Thermal system design over broad temperature scales
Mechanical, structural, vibe and acoustics
Electrical, RF / Analog, and power systems (synthesizers, power amplifiers, stabilization systems, etc.)
Real-time, embedded, or device-level application software development
Experience with defining component and/or system verification/validation campaigns through various phases of product development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast paced, dynamic work environment
Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion
You’d be a great fit with: 
M.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
Experience supporting a project through the full product development lifecycle
Successful candidates typically have 3-8 or greater years of relevant industry experience
Experience with software tools such as Jama Connect, MATLAB/Simulink, Confluence, JIRA, Git, Solidworks, and PDM systems
Understanding of system behavioral definition following model-based System Engineering practices (use case definition, states & modes development, activity diagram creation, Model-based design, etc.)
Experience with trapped ion quantum computing systems
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.

title: Electrical Engineer III
description:
About Montana Instruments:
Montana Instruments is the premier cryogenics company accelerating quantum discovery. We build market-leading systems for our partners in the quantum journey and have enjoyed 10+ years of validated success.
We Are Looking For:
Montana Instruments, a growing high-tech company in Bozeman, Montana, is seeking a talented Electrical Engineer to join our Product Development (PD) team. In this role, you’ll join a high-performing, cross-functional team where you’ll contribute to the design, development, integration, testing, and support of new cryogenic products.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with the engineering team to understand technical requirements and develop solutions
Work across company departments to communicate needs, clear project roadblocks, accomplish tasks, and align work with company priorities
Develop and maintain documentation for core engineering process and procedures
Participate in technical design reviews
Perform hands-on work in a laboratory environment for board bring-up and troubleshooting
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering
5+ years relevant work experience
Strong EE fundamentals
Familiar with computer system architecture, analog design, and digital design
Experience using typical laboratory equipment to troubleshoot electrical issues including oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, digital multimeters, function generators, or network analyzers
Desired Skills:
Proven ability to rapidly prototype designs and test concepts
Experience with mobile/embedded systems, control systems, or industrial automation
Experience effectively managing both long-term and short-term project schedules to meet deadlines in a fast paced, dynamic environment
History of applying industry best practices and modern design principles
Experience managing electrical projects from initial development through manufacturing and scale-up
Experience working with contract manufacturers and part suppliers
What We Offer You:
Competitive salaries, annual bonuses, and opportunities for growth
Comprehensive health & insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision)
HSA 1:1 match
Company paid life insurance and long-term disability
401k matching up to 3%
PTO, personal days, and company paid holidays
Company sponsored team events
Montana Instruments Values:
In all that Montana Instruments accomplishes, we stay true to our values:
Results-driven
Courageous
Team-first
We want to create an environment where champions are enabled in every area of the company. We want to hire people who have the desire and potential to do great things. We want to give people the freedom and responsibility to become champions as part of a professional team.
About Bozeman:
Montana Instruments is located in Bozeman, Montana, a vibrant town at the foot of the Bridger Mountains within an hour of three great ski hills, several world-class fly-fishing rivers, and plenty of adventure (Yellowstone National Park is just 90 minutes south).
Bozeman is Montana’s biggest tech hub and home to quantum companies like Teledyne, Flir, and ADVR Incorporated, as well as Spectrum Lab and the Borys Lab at Montana State University. It is one of the fastest-growing cities of its size in the nation and regularly recognized as one of America's "coolest" cities.

position: Principal/Sr. Principal Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer
location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
title: Principal/Sr. Principal Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Are you interested in exploring a career in the cutting edge of IC circuit design? You'll leverage your current experience against our training and your team's wealth of knowledge with the goal of designing Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL) and superconducting devices in a highly collaborative team environment.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Capabilities division is a leader in the development and manufacture of next generation high-performance computing. Superconducting electronics form the core of our technology, with development thrusts in both quantum and classical logic. Our quantum computing activities include the development of superconducting devices for both quantum annealing and gate-model quantum computation. Our classical computing activities focus on energy-efficient computation using our patented superconducting digital logic technology, RQL. With a well-established impressive performance this technology is appealing for a variety of immediate applications and future research possibilities at a time when Moore’s law is dramatically slowing. You’ll work in a fast-paced team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make these design solutions a reality.
We are seeking motivated Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit (IC) Design Engineers to join our team in design and layout of custom digital superconducting circuits. You will use your skills as an IC designer while learning about superconducting circuit design. Tasks will include schematic capture, circuit simulation, circuit layout, physical verification (LVS, DRC), and parasitic extraction for a variety of superconducting circuits. The right candidate will be comfortable in a dynamic environment with rapidly developing technologies and tools. The candidate must have some experience in custom circuit design, preferably with Cadence Virtuoso. Experience with modeling circuit performance using Spice tools or ADE/Spectre, and/or experience with EM software such as HFSS, Momentum, Clarity or CST is highly desirable. Familiarity with quantum information is a plus. The candidate must be able to take a design from concept through modeling, layout and verification and create a test plan based on circuit requirements. Strong written and oral communication skills are required.
This position can be filled at the Principal Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer OR the Sr. Principal Superconducting Electronics IC Design Engineer. Qualifications for both are listed below:
Basic Qualifications for Principal IC Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 5 years of experience in in either Analog, Digital or Mixed Signal Circuit design (3 years with technical MS or 0 years with a PhD)
Solid understanding of circuit design theory; hands-on custom circuit design experience
Experience with IC custom design tools (preferably Cadence Virtuoso) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and custom layout; physical verification using Assura or Calibre
Basic understanding of IC manufacturing and testing processes
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and milestones according to program schedule
Excellent communication skills, able to efficiently disseminate information to leadership and respective working group
Able to obtain and maintain a Top-Secret clearance per business requirements. US Citizenship is a requirement for this
Preferred Qualifications for Principal IC Design Engineer:
Understanding of hierarchical and top-down design methodology
Create and maintain chip design schedule, and meet tight deadlines in accordance with the overall program schedule
Microwave engineering background; solid understanding of transmission line theory and impedance matching techniques
Electromagnetic modeling background with commercial tools, such as HFSS, CST, Clarity
Understanding of combinatorial and sequential logic
Programming experience using an objected oriented language like Python or C++
Experience with product validation and testing
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance
Basic Qualifications for Sr. Principal IC Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 9 years of experience in either Analog, Digital or Mixed Signal Circuit design (7 years with technical MS or 4 years with a PhD).
Solid understanding of circuit design theory; extensive hands-on custom circuit design experience
Working knowledge of the IC design flow including schematic capture, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS)
Proficiency with modern IC design tools (preferably Cadence Virtuoso) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and custom layout; physical verification using Assura or Calibre
Good understanding of IC manufacturing and testing processes
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and milestones according to program schedule
Excellent communication skills, able to efficiently disseminate information to leadership and respective working group
Able to obtain and maintain a Top-Secret clearance per business requirements. US Citizenship is a requirement for this
Preferred Qualifications for Sr. Principal IC Design Engineer:
Experience with hierarchical design, top-level floor-planning, and chip-level integration
Create and maintain chip design schedule, and meet tight deadlines in accordance with the overall program schedule
Experience with product validation and testing
Microwave engineering background; solid understanding of transmission line theory and impedance matching techniques
Electromagnetic modeling background with commercial tools, such as HFSS, CST, Clarity
Understanding of combinatorial and sequential logic
Programming experience using an objected oriented language like Python or C++
Scripting experience with SKILL
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance

Zapata Computing
2 reviews

title: Frontend Engineer (Visual Analytics)
description:
About Zapata Computing
Zapata Computing, Inc. is a quantum software, services, and applications company with a mission to accelerate the quantum revolution. We are developing a software platform to solve critical problems across a wide range of industries. Zapata’s quantum platform Orquestra® combines a powerful software platform and algorithm libraries to deliver real-world solutions across a full range of classical and quantum technologies. We are fast-paced, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary. Our world-class team is creative, curious, and has a revolutionary mindset.

About our Collaboration with Andretti Autosport
Zapata is the Official Quantum Computing and machine learning provider of Andretti Autosport. Working trackside from Zapata’s mobile Racing Analytics Command Center (RACC) Center, Andretti engineers leverage Zapata’s quantum platform, Orquestra®, to deliver a race day advantage through advanced analytics and quantum techniques.

About the Role
Zapata is developing quantum algorithms to solve critical problems across a wide range of industries. This includes an ongoing partnership with Andretti Autosport, which leverages Zapata’s quantum platform, Orquestra®, to deliver a race day advantage through advanced analytics and quantum techniques. Orquestra® combines a powerful software platform and quantum algorithm libraries to deliver real-world solutions across a full range of classical and quantum technologies. As a visual analytics engineer embedded with the Andretti teams, you will work together with Andretti engineering and Zapata scientific teams to understand the data analytics needs of Andretti auto racing teams and design, develop and deploy new graphical user interfaces and visualization tools.

Key Responsibilities Include
Work across the full stack with a focus on the front end, building high performance applications for Analytics and Simulation
Develop new features and application development in support of rapidly emerging project requirements and insights for the Andretti racing teams
Work with the engineering and science teams to create new data analytics and machine learning applications and improve existing ones, from conceptualization to deployment
Ensure application performance, uptime and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality, documentation and thoughtful application design
Support the migration of relational based database to a document based database. (SQL to NoSQL)
Design and develop dashboard for teams to pull current and historical data and be able to see it in various forms (graphs, charts, etc)
Work with agile development methodologies, adhering to best practices and implementing mission critical application
Working alongside Andretti Autosport in Indianapolis and occasionally on site at races

Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science or related area
7+ years of experience building complex analytics applications
Experience building and designing real-time analytics frontends using web frameworks
Experience with Electron application development
Experience querying NoSQL data bases (eg: Couchbase, MongoDB)
Experience with HTML, CSS and Dashboard tools
Experience with time series databases and relational databases, query tools for unstructured data
Experience working with telemetry data
Expert knowledge of JavaScript, React.js/Vue.js Python and one of the following: Go, Java, Rust, C/C++
Excellent debugging and optimization skills
Unit/integration testing experience

Desired Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Mechanical or aeronautical engineering experience a plus
Preferred experience working for or following IndyCar, Formula E or F1 racing; open to other motorsports

Why Join Zapata
We are growing! We are still in early stages but are experiencing rapid growth. We welcome individuals who want to be a part of evolving technology, with teams of researchers, developers and inquisitive individuals working together to advance technology. Even though Zapata is primarily remote we intentionally foster a supportive and fun community with companywide and team events. We care about our employees’ health and well-being and offer great holiday and time off benefits, including a “summer shutdown” and end of the year closure.

Location: Hybrid; Indianapolis area. Working minimum one week per month on site with team and trackside for majority of IndyCar races (minimum 9 weekends).

Zapata is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Learn more about our team and what we do here:

https://youtu.be/3WG5yfq7uX0

title:
Quantum Information Theorist
UK - Cambridge
description:
Toshiba Europe Ltd are at the forefront of research on quantum information systems and devices. We invite applications for the post of Research Scientist in the Quantum Information Group at the Cambridge Research Laboratory. The successful candidate will lead work on analysing the security of quantum cryptography systems.
Responsibilities:
Devising new protocols for improved performance or new functionality of quantum communication systems
Security analysis of protocols for quantum cryptography
Simulating real world quantum cryptography systems and optimising performance
Analysing implementation security of real-world systems
Supporting experimentalists in Toshiba working in similar areas
Leading collaborative work with partners in the UK and Europe
Contributing to efforts to develop global standards for quantum technology

Deep knowledge of quantum cryptography protocols and security proofs
Good understanding of experimental approaches to quantum cryptography
Track record of world leading research in quantum information theory
Good communication skills, both written and verbal

title: Computational Quantum Dynamics Researcher
description:
PASQAL designs and develops Quantum Processing Units and dedicated software tools. These innovative processors address applications which are out of the reach of the most powerful existing supercomputers, encompassing real-world challenges as well as fundamental science. As they are very low energy intensive, they will significantly contribute to reduce the carbon footprint of the computing industry.
PASQAL has partnerships with key users in the fields of energy, IT, finance, drug and chemical design, automotive… The maturity and potential of our technology and the quality of our scientific team has been rewarded several times at French, European as well as global levels.
Our technology builds upon considerable knowledge accumulated over decades by the Institut d’Optique near Paris (IOGS / CNRS); it makes the best of numerous recent achievements in laser cooling of atoms, opto-electronics, vacuum and detection systems. Based in Massy and Palaiseau, at the heart of the quantum ecosystem south of Paris, PASQAL is funded by Quantonation, a VC fund focusing on Quantum Technologies, and is attracting world-class investors.
Joining PASQAL is an opportunity to contribute to the rapid development of a Deep-Tech startup at the forefront of the second Quantum Revolution. You will be directly involved in one of the greatest challenges ever, shaping the technology landscape of the 21st century. You will work among top-class engineers and scientists, competing against the world’s biggest players.
Computational Quantum Dynamics Researcher
Job description
As a member of our Simulation team, you will be instrumental to design, implement and test innovative numerical algorithms. These will range from the simulation of various aspects and phenomena encountered in Neutral Atoms QPUs (Quantum Processing Units), to the emulation of their behavior and performance for specific information processing tasks.
The Researcher leads research tasks and projects in relation with computational quantum dynamics and quantum circuit simulation, taking into account specific constraints of neutral atom QPUs. He works in close collaboration with Quantum Hardware scientists.
You will be in charge in developing and optimizing high-performance code, that you will implement and benchmark accessing both our computing GPU cluster, as well as the actual QPUs for benchmarking purpose.
Your role will be key to ensure code quality and general algorithmic efficiency of our emulators, especially to support applied research in the fields of Chemistry and Material Science.
Potential technical axes include for instance:
simulation of Quantum Circuits for Neutral atom QPUs;
Hybrid Workflows (CPU – GPU – QPU);
Quantum Dynamics algorithms for open and noisy systems…
Your missions will also include:
writing structured and documented quality code;
making sure that all code pushed to production is correctly monitored and tested;
keeping a regular technological watch.
having an inventive activity in the scientific and technical fields related to the Company’s research, products, technologies and markets; filing patents.
Location: Massy – Palaiseau (Southern Paris area – France) or Amsterdam (Netherlands)
Start date: position available now
Type of contract: permanent contract
Qualification & Experience
You own a PhD in physics, complemented with at least 3 years of post-doctoral experience in Quantum Systems.
You have an established publication track record.
Skills
The successful candidate will have the following skills:
Proficiency with at least two of C++, Julia, Python or CUDA, in demanding numerical applications.
Experience with version control, code reviews and continuous integration of code repositories.
Creative problem solver.
Agile cultural experience.
Ability to work independently with limited direction.
Curiosity and keen interest for new technologies.
English professional proficiency is mandatory to work in PASQAL’s international environment.
We are an Equal Opportunity employer.

title:
Corporate Counsel, AWS Legal
Job ID: 2219613 | Amazon.com Services LLC
description:
DESCRIPTION
Job summary
Amazon’s Legal Department is looking for a Corporate Counsel to support our AWS Quantum Computing organization, who is chartered with building and launching AWS’s first Quantum computer and Quantum networking technology.

This role provides a blend of counseling and transactional support. The transactions include a variety of complex deal types, such as hardware and software development, technology licensing, procurement, manufacturing and fabrication agreements; SaaS and hosted services agreements; professional, operations and support services; consulting agreements; and sponsored research and lab-use agreements with universities. The business counseling in this role includes product, commercial, and operational counseling on issues such as IP contamination, IP protection and licensing; procurement, supply chain, vendor and infrastructure security; product and trade compliance; and regulatory issues related to quantum technologies. This role will work directly with a wide array of teams across AWS to help shape and implement our Quantum computing legal and operational strategy.

We expect this role to own and deliver on diverse and complex transactions and projects simultaneously. This Corporate Counsel will also review, advise, develop and deliver standard operating procedures policies, trainings and business facing resources to enable the Quantum Computing organization to deliver on its mission. Successful candidates will demonstrate strong organizational and collaboration skills across multiple internal teams and with external customers and counterparties. A clear and concise communication style that is effective across internal and external teams, including technical and non-technical executives, is required.

We don’t expect every applicant to have experience working with cloud computing and we are looking for candidates who are willing to learn and develop alongside our team. Most importantly, we hire smart people of all backgrounds and experiences who demonstrate leadership and sound judgment in ambiguous situations. We need lawyers with solid legal training, who are motivated, curious, humble, and who have a good sense of humor.

At AWS Legal, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing engagement experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) conference and AmazeCon, our conference to discuss gender diversity. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles.

This position will be based in Santa Monica, CA.


Key job responsibilities
• Providing business-line counseling to the Quantum hardware, algorithms and networking teams team to enable research, development, testing and deployment of Quantum technology products globally for our customers.
• Structuring, drafting and negotiating complex commercial and technology-related agreements, including development, proof of concept, manufacturing services, software licensing, services, and other bespoke agreements.
• Supporting and directly advising business partners on legal, commercial, operational and other risks.
• Developing, advising on and implementing with the business vendor engagement, contract and negotiation strategies.
• Collaborating cross-functionally to identify and resolve commercial, operational, compliance, regulatory, security, safety, legal and customer/vendor issues and help develop policy positions on Quantum technology.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• Juris Doctor (J.D.) and membership in one state bar or equivalent.
• 5+ years of legal experience (with several years at a leading law firm or in-house experience).
• Strong transactional, drafting and negotiations experience of complex commercial or technology agreements.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• 8+ years of legal experience (with several years at a leading law firm or in-house experience).
• Experience supporting technology development, procurement, manufacturing; technology licensing; and hardware development.
• In-house experience at a technology company.
• Proven track record of strong judgment in the absence of precedence, issue spotting and problem-solving skills.
• Experience providing prompt practical, crisp and actionable legal advice.
• Ability to lead and influence cross-functionally to root cause and promptly resolve and deliver results on complicated problems.
• Curiosity and a willingness to learn and grow in a team environment.
