location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
title: Principal / Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit (IC) Design Engineer
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Are you interested in shifting into the cutting edge of IC circuit design? Your experience is needed, you'll leverage your current experience against our training and your team's experience and then you'll be designing RQL and superconducting devices in a highly collaborative environment in no time.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Capabilities division is leading the development of the next generation of high-performance computing. Superconducting electronics forms the core of our technology, with development thrusts in both quantum and classical logic. Our quantum computing activities include the development of superconducting devices for both quantum annealing and gate-model quantum computation. Our classical computing activities focus on energy-efficient computation using our patented superconducting digital logic technology, Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL). You’ll work in a fast-paced team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make these processing solutions a reality.
We are seeking Analog/Mixed Signal IC Design Engineers to join our team in design and layout of full-custom digital and mixed signal superconducting circuits. You will use your skills as an Integrated Circuit designer while learning about superconducting circuit design. Tasks will include schematic capture, circuit simulation, circuit layout, physical verification (Layout vs. Schematic and Design Rule Checking), and parasitic extraction for a variety of superconducting circuits. The right candidate will be comfortable in a dynamic environment with rapidly developing technologies and tools. The candidate must have some experience in custom circuit design, preferably with Cadence Virtuoso. Experience with modeling circuit performance in Spice or Spectre, and/or experience with physical RF modeling in HFSS or COMSOL is highly desirable. Familiarity with quantum information is a plus. The candidate must be able to create a functional verification and test plan based on requirements of the circuit. The candidate should be able to take a design from concept through physical verification. Strong written and oral communication skills are required.
This position requires on-site work at our Advanced Technology Lab (ATL) in Linthicum, Maryland.
This position can be filled at the Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer level OR the Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer. Qualifications for both are listed below:
Basic Qualifications for Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 5 years of experience in Analog/Mixed Signal Circuit design (3 years with technical MS or 0 years with a PhD) - Experience with full product life cycle (requirements, design, implementation, simulation, verification) of mixed signal design.
Working knowledge of mixed signal design flow including design, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS).
Experience with some of the following: IC custom design tools (e.g. Cadence or Mentor) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and full custom layout; mixed-signal circuit design experience (Digital and Analog); physical verification utilizing Cadence Assura or Mentor Calibre.
Ability to obtain and maintain US Security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with circuit modeling in HFSS, ADS, or Matlab.
Strong design automation skills.
Electronics test lab experience.
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics.
Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements, microwave engineering.
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance.
Basic Qualifications for Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 9 years of experience in Analog/Mixed Signal Circuit design (7 years with technical MS or 4 years with a PhD).
Experience with full product life cycle (requirements, design, implementation, simulation, verification) of mixed signal design.
Working knowledge of mixed signal design flow including design, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS).
Experience with some of the following: IC custom design tools (e.g. Cadence or Mentor) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and full custom layout; mixed-signal circuit design experience (Digital and Analog); physical verification utilizing Cadence Assura or Mentor Calibre.
Ability to obtain and maintain US Security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with circuit modeling in HFSS, ADS, or Matlab.
Strong design automation skills - Electronics test lab experience.
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics.
Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements, microwave engineering.
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance.
"

title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Quantum Operating Systems
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for a Senior Manager, Software Engineering to lead the development of the core of our quantum operating system, in partnership with our principal engineers. Never worked on a quantum operating system? It's much like a robot operating system, managing feedback loops between sensors and actuators at various time scales to precisely tune an environment where we can perform high fidelity quantum computations. In this role, you'll help hire, grow, and coordinate our quantum OS team, helping us continue to build the world's best quantum computers.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous initiatives, balancing multiple activities with a keen eye for prioritizing for the biggest impact. You'll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices with lasting impact. You'll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment. You'll enjoy learning technical topics, working across multiple business streams, and be uniquely positioned to help us reach the next horizon in secure quantum computing.
Responsibilities:
Ensure high quality, scalable, well-tested software through architecture and code reviews
Provide technical expertise in building robust and well-engineered software solutions
Own the engineering roadmap for your team
Grow a team of Software Engineers with deep expertise working with hardware and automation
Lead the team through identification and negotiation of product scope and schedule
Effectively self-manage technical roadmaps, multiple projects, priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Identify, track and mitigate execution roadblocks and technical risks
Assist in the career development of others, including performance assessments for mid-year and end-of-year reviews, and providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Work with cross-functional teams to make forward-looking engineering choices, between the cloud platform that feeds jobs to our OS and the real-time subsystem that executes programs on behalf of the OS
Provide clear, concise communication to management, product development teams, and customers
Collaborate and communicate with physicists, designers, electrical engineers, external vendors, and other software engineering managers
Drive continuous improvement to an established product development process
In your first three months, you'll be helping hire key staff to scale this function, and defining the technical vision for the next year—and beyond
You'd be a good fit with:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related field, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
10+ years programming experience in Go, Rust, or C++, or similar systems-level programming language
Comfort in resource-constrained, multithreaded execution environments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven working experience with highly-structured data
Experience in working with technical experts outside of traditional software engineering, particularly electrical engineers and physicists
Knowledge of team management best practices and demonstrated experience building and scaling effective teams
Empathy and customer focus: you'll work closely with our internal team of physicists who depend on our software every day
You'd be a great fit with:
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statics, Physics, Electrical Engineering or a related degree
10+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
Experience with embedded systems
A background in robotics, digital signal processing, control theory, machine learning and/or mathematical optimization
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Solutions Engineer
Qrypt builds quantum-secure encryption software and hardware in partnership with world-class national laboratories and academic institutions. We value protecting individual privacy and being transparent about the technology we use to enable it. The foundation of Qrypt technology is published by our experts in peer-reviewed scientific journals and supported by a growing portfolio of international patents. Qrypt’s product portfolio builds on these technologies to ensure enduring data security in the quantum age.
Qrypt is seeking a Solutions Engineer who will be responsible for designing the enablement plans and configuration specifications and perform installation processes to integrate software systems and products for customers. You will establish yourself as the subject matter expert and product-area expert to provide engineering solutions for our customers. We are seeking someone who is passionate about providing the most impactful solution for our clients’ business needs.
Preferred location is New York City and will consider remote.
Responsibilities
Works with product, marketing, business development and sales to ensure we can effectively market, price, sell and service the solution
Collaborates to identify and prioritize product and integration enhancements based on client requests and technical obstacles
Develops program and system specifications to meet customers’ technical requirements
Conducts process assessments with customers, builds proof of concept to validate requirements, builds and presents customer specific business cases.
Provides technical information, requirements and cost estimates for proposals, quotes and statements of work
Documents processes and solutions for reuse and scalability
Collaborates with clients post-sales to ensure their success
Minimum Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience (working in solutions engineering, technical sales, software development)
Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to process and understand technical documentation
Deep technical expertise in Cloud and Enterprise Software
Pre-sales or post-sales experience working in a SaaS software company
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s in computer science or solid knowledge of CS fundamentals
Experience in the cybersecurity field
Experience with encryption technologies
Experience programming with Python, Rust, C, C++
Attitude
You are comfortable working in an environment built around security and privacy
You want to be part of a team creating products that impact the world for better
You are self-motivated, a strong individual contributor with intellectual curiosity and propensity for action, results and continuous process improvement
You are a strong communicator, able to communicate with stakeholders, helping to define the product roadmap by providing technical expertise
You are interested in working with leading technologies in data and information security, including quantum encryption, post-quantum cryptography, and privacy preservation techniques
Benefits & Perks
Competitive Pay & Equity
Medical, dental & vision plan participation
Strong 401K matching program
In-office free lunch & snacks
Gym Reimbursement
But above all, be part of an amazing team! Together, we’ll make this world a safer place!
About Qrypt
Qrypt is an early-stage technology startup building the next generation of cryptography to protect from the threat of quantum computers and those machines and mathematics yet to be invented. Our passion is to help organizations and people keep their data private – forever. We securely build, design, and deploy safe systems that ensure people’s privacy. Together, we will transform the way the world safeguards data and communications!
The worldwide cyber community is undergoing a once-in-a-generation transition to quantum-safe technologies, with Qrypt leading the way. Qrypt participates in global standards bodies for communications security, financial transactions, and critical infrastructure. We are founding members of the national Quantum Economic Development Consortium and the Mid-Atlantic Quantum Alliance.
90SiVDTApV
Job Type: Full-time

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Ready to join the AQ era?
SandboxAQ is solving challenging problems with AI + Quantum for positive impact. We partner with global leaders in government, academia, and the private sector to identify applications that would benefit from quantum-based applications to current and future commercial challenges. We engage with customers early and throughout the development process to improve market fit.
Our team's unique approach enables cross-pollination across a diverse range of fields, from physics, computer science, neuroscience, mathematics, cryptography, natural sciences and more! Our success comes from coalescing diverse talent to create an environment where experimental thinking and collaboration yield breakthrough AI + Quantum solutions. Join a culture where thought leadership, diverse talent, employee engagement, and technological impact will create the next tech uproar.
We are deeply committed to education as a means to advance quantum solutions and computing initiatives. We invest in future talent through internship programs, research papers, developer tools, textbooks, educational talks/events and partnerships with universities/talent hubs to attract multi-disciplinary talent. Our hope is to inspire people from all walks of life to be prepared for the quantum era and encourage a path in STEM.
About The Role:

SandboxAQ is a global team exploring the intersection of physics and artificial intelligence. We pursue near-term impact through rapid prototyping of quantum and quantum-inspired platforms that can be deployed by enterprises to surmount real-world challenges. At SandboxAQ we cross-pollinate ideas among a range of fields - natural sciences, computer science, medicine, and mathematics, to name just a few - to approach problems from a novel perspective. Our goal is to create a world-leading platform to revolutionize material design, chemical analysis, and drug development.
We are looking for a Product Manager who will ensure the success of our novel AI and Quantum platform for drug discovery. As a Product Manager, you will help shape the product vision, get deep with the technical team, and will drive the product strategy and roadmap for this new product. You will identify business opportunities, understand customer needs, and analyze market requirements to help us create a leading computational software platform. You will set milestones and prioritize development to reach our goals in a timely manner. You will align stakeholders, build consensus, and drive decision-making. You will build and nurture partnerships with industry leaders, the scientific community, and high-profile stakeholders.
Core Responsibilities:
Own product strategy and roadmap for our computational software platform.
Coordinate strategy and help translate product vision into tactical roadmap and organization planning. Advocate for your plans effectively across the organization.
Qualitatively and quantitatively identify business opportunities in the space of high-performance computational modeling in general, and material and drug design in particular
Work with a multidisciplinary team of research scientists and engineers to bring our platform vision to life
Assess the current landscape of quantum-aided and quantum-inspired technologies
Working closely with customers, align technical development with customer requirements, customer feedback and market requirements
Identify and build relationships with industry leaders and research institutions to formulate and secure strategic partnerships
Who you are:
3+ years industry experience in a product manager role, with experience executing from product vision to launch
You have a track record of setting milestones, assessing/adjusting priorities, and delivering what you promised
You are comfortable navigating conflicting priorities and ambiguous problems and thrive in a fast moving startup environment
Ph.D. or commensurate experience in Physics, Chemistry, Bioinformatics or related field
5+ years industry experience in computational chemistry or related software engineering role
Solid understanding of scientific concepts, and ability to lead high-level scientific discussions about molecular biology, computational chemistry, material science or computational physics
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to explain complex ideas to a broad audience
Capable of establishing strong working relationships across a distributed organization.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years industry experience in a product manager role
Experience with drug discovery and bringing projects from ideation to market.
Experience developing and launching products in both the private and public sector in areas related to materials, drug design, or similar
Proficiency with AI and/or scientific computing
Masters or Ph.D. in one of the STEM fields or related areas
SandboxAQ welcomes all.
We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where we have zero tolerance for discrimination. We invest in our employees' personal and professional growth. Once you work with us, you can't go back to normalcy because great breakthroughs come from great teams and we are the best in quantum technology.
We offer competitive salaries, stock options depending on employment type, education stipends, medical/dental/vision, family planning/fertility, PTO (summer and winter breaks), financial wellness resources, 401(k) plans, and more.
Equal Employment Opportunity: All qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Accommodations: we provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in job application procedures for open roles. If you need such an accommodation.

title: Experimental Physicist
description:
Overview:
SRI International's Advanced Technology and Systems Division (ATSD) performs research and development across a wide range of technical domains for applications including advanced sensing, imaging, navigation and timing systems. SRI specializes in transitioning technology from basic R&D to fieldable prototypes for both US government and commercial customers.

SRI ATSD has an opening for Experimental Physicist within the Quantum & Semiconductor (Q&S) Laboratory in Princeton, NJ. The Q&S Lab conducts R&D in the domains of quantum sensing (cold-atom through vapor-cell physics), III-V semiconductors and device physics toward single-photon imaging systems, and mixed-signal electronics for national security applications. In each of these areas, we develop new technologies with applications in electromagnetic field sensing, Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT), Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR), low-light short-wave infrared imaging, and chip-scale mixed-signal hardware security.
Responsibilities:
A successful applicant will have a general experimental physics background and will work in the laboratory with other scientists and engineers on a variety of topics. They will contribute on current programs and grow into a task leader and Principal Investigator (PI).

A successful applicant will have a PhD in physics, applied physics, or engineering. The exact domain of expertise is less important than a demonstrated ability to develop both hardware and software in an R&D context. They will be very comfortable in the lab, operating with initiative to design, build and integrate new experimental setups that involve advanced AMO and/or device physics instrumentation (optical, mechanical, vacuum, electronic, and instrumentation subsystems).
Qualifications:
PhD in experimental physics, electrical engineering, applied physics, engineering physics, or related discipline
Due to government requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required with the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Must have experience in:
Developing R&D plans to solve complex problems
Laboratory experimental hardware development experience
General data analysis skills, typical of those learned in graduate school physics and engineering programs
Presentation of complex technical topics to a diverse audience
Working in teams
Managing multiple priorities
Reviewing technical work of others and providing actionable feedback

Desirable skills include:
Experience in precision measurements
Photon shot noise limited measurements
Experience with all, or subsets of, laser systems, optics, vacuum systems, RF, electronics and data-acquisition systems
Knowledge of electromagnetics
Experience with laboratory design and testing of optical systems, including photonic integrated circuits.
Should also possess strong numerical and analytical modeling skills (e.g. Python, Matlab, C++, COMSOL, etc.)
Working knowledge of data acquisition and control systems (e.g. LabView) and signal processing
Familiarity with physical measurements and laboratory instrumentation
Physical and mechanical intuition
Intangibles
Detail-oriented
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Able to work in a team environment
Self-motivated
Must possess a results-oriented approach
Interest in a broad range of technical areas

SRI International, an over 75-year strong pioneering research institute, has a rich history supporting government and industry. Our innovations have created new industries, billions of dollars in market value and lasting benefits to society. SRI is organized around broad disciplines and capabilities, with research and development divisions and labs to groups who excel at identifying new opportunities, developing products and creating custom solutions. Our organization is driven by impact - delivering unique solutions for the world's important challenges and transforming ideas into reality for clients and partners.

position: Principal Quantum Physicist/Sr. Principal Quantum Physicist
location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
title: Principal Quantum Physicist/Sr. Principal Quantum Physicist
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace! Do you enjoy a culture where your voice is valued? Start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our world’s biggest challenges. Here at Northrop Grumman, we take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today. As a company, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive workforce and understand that our employees are at their best with a healthy work-life balance, both of which are examples of the many benefits of joining our team!
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking Physicists. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Transformational Technology Business Area, which is focused on developing innovative next generation superconducting electronics (SCE) and advanced computing technologies.
This position requires work onsite at our Advanced Technology Lab (ATL) facility in Linthicum, Maryland.
This requisition may be filled at a Principal Physicist or a Sr. Principal Physicist based on years of relevant experience and capabilities in the areas listed below.
Basic Qualifications for a Principal Quantum Physicist:
Must have a Masters in Physics or Applied Physics plus 3 years of relevant experience or a Ph.D. in Physics or Applied Physics (or will complete by December 2022).
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance (US citizenship is required for this)
Proven skills at tackling/solving complex problems
A strong ability to learn new topics quickly in a fast-paced environment
A highly motivated self-starter
Works well in a collaborative, diverse environment
Basic Qualifications for a Sr. Principal Quantum Physicist:
Must have a Masters in Physics or Applied Physics plus 7 years of relevant experience or a Ph.D. in Physics or Applied Physics with 4 years of relevant experience.
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance (US citizenship is required for this)
Proven skills at tackling/solving complex problems
A strong ability to learn new topics quickly in a fast-paced environment
A highly motivated self-starter
Works well in a collaborative, diverse environment
Active Areas of Research and Job Opportunities in this Position:
Superconducting electronics
Qubits/quantum computing
Designing/testing/modeling quantum information systems
Digital logic design/development
Low-temperature experiments
Microwave engineering
Decoherence mechanisms
Materials research
Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL)
Superconducting circuit design
Recently, talented physicists in the areas of quantum optics, solid-state qubits, particle astrophysics, plasma physics, and neutron scattering have joined our team. Applicants of various physics backgrounds are welcome to apply! Candidates are encouraged to highlight their interests or experiences with any of the active research areas listed above, as well as how they meet the basic qualifications.

title: Software Development Manager - Quantum Software
description:
About Xanadu:
Xanadu’s mission is to build quantum computers that are useful and available to people everywhere.

At Xanadu, we are learners, innovators, researchers, collaborators and problem solvers. We are creating something that has never been built before. What we are doing is extremely hard, the classic moon shot. Few people in their life will be able to be a part of something like this, where if we are successful, the technologies we develop will solve some of the world’s most challenging problems, and literally change the world. And that is something to be excited about!

title: Staff Systems Engineer
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for Systems Engineers (multiple levels) with experience in leading and supporting multi-disciplined engineering teams through the product development lifecycle. As a member of the Engineering organization, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
In this role you will develop requirements, model architectures, complete trade studies, define verification criteria, and complete system analyses for our current and next generation of quantum computers.
Responsibilities:
Lead/Support development teams in the System Engineering lifecycle for quantum computing programs/projects including requirements development, architecture decomposition, system analyses (reliability, maintainability, etc.), integration and test planning, and system verification
Translate stakeholder and product requirements into design specifications
Perform operational and functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition for first of a kind prototypes as well as production quantum computing systems
Support program & executive leadership through the identification of risk and risk mitigation plans
Support technical publications of system requirements documents, interface control documents, verification procedures and reports
Hands-on modeling, design, integration, test, and verification support of our quantum computers across lab facilities requiring skills in algorithms, software, hardware, and networking
You'd be a good fit with:
B.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
A breadth of deep understanding, backed by experience, of the principles, concepts, and methods of systems engineering such as concept development, requirement definition, functional decomposition and allocation, design solution definition, implementation, integration, verification and validation, qualification, commissioning, and operations
Experience with system performance definition through requirements analysis using modeling tools
Understanding of industry best practices in requirements creation, decomposition, and management
Demonstrated technical depth with one or more of the following subject areas and/or subsystems:
Trapped ion systems
AMO physics
Ultra-high vacuum systems
Chip scale device design, packaging, and fabrication – semiconductor level modules and systems
Optics and lasers (NIR and visible, pulsed and CW), precision micro- and bulk- optics, free space and fiber, optical sensors
Integrated photonic components (active and passive)
Thermal system design over broad temperature scales
Mechanical, structural, vibe and acoustics
Electrical, RF / Analog, and power systems (synthesizers, power amplifiers, stabilization systems, etc.)
Real-time, embedded, or device-level application software development
Experience with defining component and/or system verification/validation campaigns through various phases of product development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast paced, dynamic work environment
Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion
You'd be a great fit with:
M.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
Experience supporting a project through the full product development lifecycle
Successful candidates typically have 3-8 or greater years of relevant industry experience
Experience with software tools such as Jama Connect, MATLAB/Simulink, Confluence, JIRA, Git, Solidworks, and PDM systems
Understanding of system behavioral definition following model-based System Engineering practices (use case definition, states & modes development, activity diagram creation, Model-based design, etc.)
Experience with trapped ion quantum computing systems
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

Lead/Support development teams in the System Engineering lifecycle for quantum computing programs/projects including requirements development, architecture decomposition, system analyses (reliability, maintainability, etc.), integration and test planning, and system verification
Translate stakeholder and product requirements into design specifications
Perform operational and functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition for first of a kind prototypes as well as production quantum computing systems
Support program & executive leadership through the identification of risk and risk mitigation plans
Support technical publications of system requirements documents, interface control documents, verification procedures and reports
Hands-on modeling, design, integration, test, and verification support of our quantum computers across lab facilities requiring skills in algorithms, software, hardware, and networking
You'd be a good fit with:
B.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
A breadth of deep understanding, backed by experience, of the principles, concepts, and methods of systems engineering such as concept development, requirement definition, functional decomposition and allocation, design solution definition, implementation, integration, verification and validation, qualification, commissioning, and operations
Experience with system performance definition through requirements analysis using modeling tools
Understanding of industry best practices in requirements creation, decomposition, and management
Demonstrated technical depth with one or more of the following subject areas and/or subsystems:
Trapped ion systems
AMO physics
Ultra-high vacuum systems
Chip scale device design, packaging, and fabrication – semiconductor level modules and systems
Optics and lasers (NIR and visible, pulsed and CW), precision micro- and bulk- optics, free space and fiber, optical sensors
Integrated photonic components (active and passive)
Thermal system design over broad temperature scales
Mechanical, structural, vibe and acoustics
Electrical, RF / Analog, and power systems (synthesizers, power amplifiers, stabilization systems, etc.)
Real-time, embedded, or device-level application software development
Experience with defining component and/or system verification/validation campaigns through various phases of product development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast paced, dynamic work environment
Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion
You'd be a great fit with:
M.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
Experience supporting a project through the full product development lifecycle
Successful candidates typically have 3-8 or greater years of relevant industry experience
Experience with software tools such as Jama Connect, MATLAB/Simulink, Confluence, JIRA, Git, Solidworks, and PDM systems
Understanding of system behavioral definition following model-based System Engineering practices (use case definition, states & modes development, activity diagram creation, Model-based design, etc.)
Experience with trapped ion quantum computing systems

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
description: Qblox is looking for an embedded software engineer to help us build a control stack for an industrial-scale quantum computer. These quantum control stacks generate the analog signals needed for the control and readout of quantum bits. The stack Qblox develops consists of a distributed architecture of parallel Qubit Readout and Qubit Control Modules, each running its own operating system and embedded software application. Our technology is used around the globe by world-class research teams. Your role as an embedded software engineer will involve the development and testing of software running on our embedded processors that are part of these modules. You will work closely with a team of electrical engineers, digital design engineers and application engineers to simulate, implement and test your work in real quantum computing setups.

description:

Our team's unique approach enables cross-pollination across a diverse range of fields, from physics, computer science, neuroscience, mathematics, cryptography, natural sciences and more! In the tech and intelligence worlds, a sandbox is where innovation is born. It's a place where the brightest free-thinking minds from across disciplines come together to reimagine what's possible. A collaborative environment where the whole is greater than the sum of the parts.
At Sandbox AQ, this forward-looking vision is core to everything we do. It's how we became who we are, and it's how we know our solutions can shift the way businesses compete in tomorrow's marketplace. AI + quantum will address significant business and scientific challenges – and that's where Sandbox AQ comes in.

title:
This job has expired on Indeed
Reasons could include: the employer is not accepting applications, is not actively hiring, or is reviewing applications
description:
Secure communication technologies are the backbone of today’s digital economy. However, the security of many of the cryptographic tools used today is threatened by the advent of the quantum computer. A quantum computer will be able to solve efficiently some of the mathematical problems which are the basis of today's public key cryptography. This has stimulated great interest in developing new cryptographic techniques with security based on quantum physics, rather than difficult mathematical problems, and which will therefore remain secure in the quantum era.

Quantum communications is a rapidly maturing technology that solves this problem by distributing secret digital keys using quantum light. As a frontier technology, quantum communications is inherently multidisciplinary. This requires the careful fusion of quantum physics, high-speed electronics, low-loss photonics and high-performance software to generate, manipulate and measure light.

While quantum communications has already been successfully deployed to many optical networks worldwide, this has always employed “standard” single-mode telecommunication fibre. Recently, there has been great progress in the development of next-generation optical fibres, using novel physical designs to achieve very different optical guidance characteristics. Such geometries include hollow-core and few-mode fibres, which offer many advantages for optical communications. This enables, for example, spatial division multiplexing to enhance the classical data-carrying capacity of fibre and reduction of nonlinear and dispersive effects, as well as reduced latency. Novel types of fibres could also offer many benefits for quantum communications, which this project will explore in detail.

This project is funded by a 4 year EPSRC Industrial CASE PhD Studentship and is a collaboration between Toshiba Europe Limited and the University of Cambridge. Candidates should be eligible for an EPSRC award, should hold (or expect) a first degree (min grade 2.1) in Physics, Electronic Engineering or other relevant discipline and should have solid background in optics and quantum physics.

title: Quantum Error Correction Architect
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution. 
Scaling quantum computers to world-changing levels will take powerful error correction. In fact, the first fault-tolerant error-corrected qubit was demonstrated on a trapped-ion quantum computer at our cofounder’s lab! We’re looking for a Quantum Error Correction Architect to help take us there.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts, projects, and initiatives. You’ll have excellent interpersonal skills, and be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment.
In your first three months, you’ll begin developing our long-term roadmap for quantum error correction.
Responsibilities:
Develop quantum error correction codes optimized for our current-generation hardware, while helping to co-design new quantum error correction codes in collaboration with our next-generation hardware.
Develop scalable architectures and strategies to execute practical quantum algorithms with increasing levels of complexity using the quantum error correcting codes
Help inform system-level requirements (error rates, classical computing requirements, etc.) to enable efficient error correction
Perform modeling and trade-studies to inform the optimal architecture for our next-generation error-corrected systems
Work with algorithm developers to devise useful error-detection and mitigation strategies for  important near-term applications.
Communicate ground-breaking results both internally and externally through publications and presentations
You’d be a good fit with:
PhD or equivalent industry experience in quantum error correction or related field
3+ years of post-PhD or industry experience in quantum error correction
5+ years writing high-performance production software in a general purpose language like Python or C++
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
You’d be a great fit with:
10+ years post-PhD or equivalent industry experience in quantum error correction
Prior experience in theoretical quantum computer science and/or theoretical physics
Prior experience working with computer architecture and/or quantum computers
Prior experience working with experimental physicists
Prior experience working with trapped-ion quantum computers

Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a five-minute walk from the Metro. title: Optical System Engineer
description:
QuEra Computing is seeking an experienced optical system engineer to join our growing team and help create the world’s largest and first commercially relevant quantum computing platform. One of the key elements of the platform is quality optical systems that are tailor-made to our quantum machines. As an optical system engineer, you will work closely with a team of AMO scientists and engineers to support optical systems development, integration, and testing. Job responsibilities include development, testing, and manufacturing optical systems that include free-space, fiber-optic components, and lasers. Familiarity with quantum computing is not necessary for this position, but candidates should display a deep interest in quantum technologies and be self-motivated in a collaborative working environment.
Candidates should have
An advanced degree in physics or engineering, or equivalent years of relevant industry experience
Hands-on experience in optics lab
Communication skills: proficient in explaining basic physical concepts, design decisions and experimental results
Meticulous attention to detail
Preferred qualifications include
Development and test experience of optical and laser systems using simulation tools, for example, Zemax
Knowledge of lab automation and programming language for data collection and analysis, such as Python
A record of accomplishment of innovation in optics, for example, through journal publications, patents, or product development cycles

title: Embedded Labview Engineer
description:
ColdQuanta is the leader in Cold Atom Quantum Technology, the most scalable, versatile, and commercially viable area of quantum. ColdQuanta is dedicated to making quantum a reality through the deployment of Information Processing Systems; and development of precision timing, sensing and networking solutions. ColdQuanta’s Quantum Signal Processing (QSP) team is lowering the barriers associated with quantum technology development, research, and education. The QSP team is developing cloud-based quantum signal processing platforms. Recipient of the 2022 SPIE Prism Award for top quantum innovation, ColdQuanta’s QSP Platforms will revolutionize the future of quantum technologies.
This position requires programming and interacting with the NI PXI controller and PXI cards for controlling a BEC experiment for the Albert team; this includes both the user interface and the hardware control. There are also NI cRIO controllers used on other projects that might require occasional software updates and maintenance that this person must attend to.

Excellent working knowledge of LabVIEW
Extensive experience with LabVIEW Real-Time, LabVIEW FPGA
Experience with C/C++ and Python is highly desired
Knowledge of electronics
experience using bench test equipment including spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, signal generators

description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for a Financial Reporting Staff Accountant. As a Financial Reporting Staff Accountant, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.

In this position, you will report to the Manager of Financial Reporting. The Financial Reporting Staff Accountant will also work closely with other senior accounting team members including the Assistant Controller and Accounting Manager and will assist in supporting the external quarterly reviews and year-end audit, participate in equity, warrants and investment accounting and assist in special projects as needed. This position will mostly work remotely, periodically working on-site at our headquarters to facilitate team collaboration. A successful candidate will have knowledge of SEC disclosure rules and requirements and be able to apply accounting knowledge, critical thinking, and analytical skills to be a part of dynamic, first class, highly scalable and efficient financial reporting team for a high-growth, high-tech company.

Responsibilities:
Assist with the preparation of the Company's SEC filings, including Forms 10-K, 10-Q and 8-K quarterly earnings release

Perform Sarbanes-Oxley key controls in a timely manner when implemented
Design processes to make all procedures more efficient and accurate, including identifying areas to better leverage our accounting systems to increase automation

Provide backup support for other positions within the department as needed
Support the SEC Reporting Team in special projects as needed

You'd be a good fit with:
BS/BA in Accounting or Finance
Strong analytical and organizational and presentation skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage deadline requirements and multi-task projects
High competency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

You'd be a great fit with:
CPA preferred
SEC reporting experience preferred
Experience with a Big Four accounting firm or other national accounting firm is preferred
Strong desire and ability to develop new skills quickly in a fast-paced, high-volume environment to continuously improve processes
Willingness to take on challenges and think constructively to solve problems
Experience with SaaS and software industries preferred
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

title: QUANTUM COMPUTING SME
description:
Quantum Computing SME
The Challenge:
What if you could use your scientific and engineering skills to inform advanced research projects in quantum computing? As a quantum scientist, you understand the challenges, opportunities, and limitations in developing quantum computing systems. That knowledge is key when it comes to assisting the U.S. Government with quantum computing technologies.
On our team, you will have the opportunity to work with world-class scientists and engineers to evaluate and advance cutting-edge quantum technologies. You will leverage technical expertise to support senior Government decision-makers with the strategic evaluation of new concepts and assessments of technological gaps. You will support our client’s mission by providing recommendations on the feasibility and potential impact of current and future quantum capabilities through preparing in-depth analyses, conducting background research, and interfacing with the R&D community. This position is a hybrid role with a combination of working at a Booz Allen office or client site and working remotely.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
3+ years of experience in quantum mechanics, quantum computing, quantum materials, or quantum information science
Knowledge of multiple aspects of a quantum computing software stack, including quantum computing software, classical control, quantum error correction, decoders, qubit types and associated hardware, and environmental control systems or dilution refrigerators
Ability to demonstrate contributions through scientific publications, white papers, or presentations in quantum mechanics, quantum information science, quantum computing, or quantum materials
Ability to convey technical information to a diverse audience both through written reports and presentations
Ability to evaluate a wide range of technical and non-technical material and rapidly ascertain and explain utility and impact
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Master's degree
Nice If You Have:
5+ years of experience in quantum computing
Experience with leading and managing a small team
Knowledge of software development and programming in languages, including Python and C++
Doctorate degree in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, or a similar technical field
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.
Build Your Career:
Consulting at Booz Allen means empowering you to provide your customers with the best support. With a consulting career at Booz Allen, you’ll have access to:
a large business consulting community
experts in virtually every field
a culture that focuses on supporting our employees
We have opportunities that provide stability while offering variety, so you can find the right fit for your career — and your life. You’ll also have access to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. With contracts across the globe in multiple industries, no matter where you want to go with your consulting career, we have the path that takes you there.
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

description:
About us
We hold the key to making quantum useful! Q-CTRL is a company with a deep start-up spirit with offices in Sydney, Los Angeles and Berlin. Our goal is to revolutionise the way quantum technology is used by delivering transformational, real-life outcomes for the world’s most innovative and impactful industry. Simply put, we make quantum technology useful.

We’re led by our values; to be real, be trusted, be just and to be revered. They guide us in everything we do, how we work together and how we shape the future of the quantum field. To help us do that, we’ve brought together an inspiring team of world leading physicists, engineers, product and design specialists (to name a few!). So whether you’re a quantum expert or simply unsure where you fit into a business like ours, we want to hear from you!

Reporting to the Head of Product, this is a newly created opportunity to lead, own and launch one of our new quantum control solutions. You’ll be a part of our world leading product team working closely with our key stakeholders across: quantum research & engineering, technology, design and marketing, responsible for our product led growth strategy.
What you'll be doing:
Own the Problem: Own the problem space, along with the opportunity and agency to solve challenges. You’re unafraid of the unknown and maintain a figure-it-out mindset
Bring Teams Together: Drive product development, roadmaps, and go-to-market strategy with world-class engineers, designers, and marketers while upholding world-class development process and craft
Outcomes over Output: Proactively iterate on features based on customer data, feedback, and technology and market trends, evolving the product and optimising for customer impact and the potential of the development team
Build for Scale: Leverage expertise in product technology stacks to inform and guide development teams to build platform features at scale
Ideally you'll have:
5+ years product management or related industry experience
Experience identifying significant opportunities, and driving product vision, strategies, requirements, and roadmaps in the context of broader organisational strategies and goals
Experience going through a full product development lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritisation and pre/post-launch execution
Enthusiasm and resilience in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm
Worked in a technical environment with a broad, cross functional team, often with a lot of uncertainty, to align the team and execute towards key milestones
Comfortable delivering technical presentations and presenting to customers and executives
Why Q-CTRL?

Flexibility: We embrace hybrid and remote work so you can focus more on your global impact rather than rigid work schedules
Parental support: Family comes first. We offer paid parental leave to support you and your family
Diversity: As an equal employment opportunity employer, we value diversity, inclusion and providing equal opportunities to all. We do this by actively supporting community initiatives around the world promoting diversity and including in STEM among others
Competitive remuneration: Enjoy the start-up life without start-up wages
Equity: We offer the potential for equity share and annual bonuses so you have a sense of ownership in what you do
Well funded: We closed our Series B in November 2021
Unique culture: You’ll be surrounded by leading physicists, engineers, product, marketing and design teams globally with a strong desire to learn and transfer knowledge
Our values: You’ll work alongside our incredibly supportive team that works consistently to deliver our core values to be real, be trusted, be just and to be revered
Personal development: We provide you with a generous personal development and wellness budget
Meaningful work: Last but not least, you’ll have the opportunity to work in one of the world’s leading deep technology companies and truly make an impact that matters!

Please note: Q-CTRL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. We are committed to being inclusive in the way we hire. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the requirements mentioned in the job posting.

To recruitment agencies, we do not accept unsolicited branded profiles and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Development
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for a Staff Software Development Engineer working as part of IonQ's system performance optimization team. As a Staff Software Development Engineer, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
One of the most exciting and challenging aspects of building a quantum computer is the complexity of the system and the interdisciplinary nature of the work. The performance optimization team aims to use modeling, optimization, characterization, and automation to take all-up system performance to the next level. We're looking for a motivated software engineer to join our team to build out and integrate our tool chain.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain our tool chain of modeling, characterization, optimization, and calibration tools
Connect our performance optimization tools to other parts of the stack
Extend the functionality of our tools in response to internal and external customer requirements
Independently manage deadlines priorities
Collaborate with scientists and engineers to understand challenges and opportunities
You'd be a good fit with:
3+ years professional software engineering experience
Experience developing software in a science / engineering R&D environment
MS in physics or related field
You'd be a great fit with:

5+ years professional software engineering experience
PhD in physics or related field
Expert knowledge of performance-oriented python programming
Demonstrated knowledge of modern machine learning techniques and packages
Experience in robotics, control systems, or large-scale optimization
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Research Scientist - Quantum Chemistry
description:
QuEra Computing is seeking talented, impact-motivated theoretical researchers with strong expertise in quantum chemistry. You will be part of the team to develop and implement novel schemes for performing quantum chemistry calculations on our unique hardware. You will have the opportunity to work with a vibrant community of academic collaborators and to help our growing team of diverse experts to address fascinating challenges, from the development of new quantum algorithms for challenging chemistry and material science problems to the co-design of algorithms and hardware with our unique Rydberg atom quantum computer with long-range connectivity, and finally to the implementation of these algorithms on large-scale quantum devices. You will also have the opportunity to interact with clients and develop solutions based on their needs.
For this role, qualified applicants should have
A PhD degree in chemistry, material science, physics, computer science, or a related discipline, or equivalent practical experience
A background in computational quantum chemistry
Knowledge of quantum computing and its applications in quantum chemistry
An exceptional publication record in relevant fields, including computational chemistry, variational quantum algorithms, digital quantum simulation
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Preferred qualifications include:
Experience estimating and optimizing resource costs for quantum computing, in either the NISQ or fault-tolerant regime
Experience with software development and high-performance computing

title: Senior Engineer, Packaging
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
We are looking for a Senior Packaging Engineer to lead the design, development, and characterization of our current and future trapped-ion package systems, which serve as the heart of IonQ's quantum computers. In this role, you will work with a diverse team of electronic and optical packaging engineers, thermal and mechanical engineers, and FMEA engineers dedicated to this goal. In addition, you will work closely with other quantum system leads, defining subsystem interfaces and exploring design-space constraints and tradeoffs to optimize full-quantum-computer-system performance.
Responsibilities:
Lead the mechanical design, development, and characterization of novel ion-trap-module consisting of electrical and optical packaging techniques
Coordinate the full packaging development lifecycle of novel hybrid optical and electronic systems; including detailed design, creation of statements of work for internal and external activities, procurement of components and materials, characterization and testing, and validation.
Coordinate with other quantum system leads to define and explore subsystem interfaces and constraints
Scope and set objectives for new technical projects centered on thermo-mechanical packaging analysis
Guide the technical direction of projects and work with your team to develop and implement creative technical solutions to challenging problems
Develop project timelines, identifying key decision dates and completion dates
Monitor project performance to understand impacts to cost, schedule, and technical performance; actively prioritize deliverables: determine critical path amongst cross-functional deliverables
Conduct risk analysis and develop mitigation plans to ensure on-time release and delivery of project deliverables
Assist with the transition from research and development to production, including development of first articles and technology demonstrations
You'd be a good fit with :
Bachelors or higher in Engineering or relevant field/discipline
5+ years of hands-on electronics or optics device packaging experience, especially with systems which undergo stress cycling
5+ years leading a high-precision packaging development effort in industry
Experience with FMEA
Experience with thermal, electrical, and mechanical modeling of micro-fabricated devices in Ansys, COMSOL, or similar
Expertise in identifying and using packaging techniques, components, and materials to manage mechanical stress and thermal expansion/contraction
UHV device/component handling and knowledge of cryogenic and UHV-compatible materials
Understanding of cleanroom procedures
Experience with data aggregation and statistical analysis/reporting
Experience using 3D CAD tools like Autodesk Inventor or Solidworks
Excellent communication skills and ability to work on and lead a team
You'd be a great fit with :
PhD in Engineering or relevant field/discipline
Experience with micro-optics assembly and packaging, including optical fiber-to-chip attachment for photonic integrated circuits (PICs)
SEM and profilometry experience
Programming experience in MATLAB, Python, or other engineering relevant language
Process development experience using Design of Experiments and Six Sigma methodologies
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

description:
Introduction
IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Bring IBM Quantum to life on social platforms through relevant story-driven content and ongoing connection to our communities, clients, and key audiences.
As the IBM Quantum Social Media Manager, you are responsible for the day-to-day development and execution of our social media campaigns collaborating with the Marketing, Communications, Product, Partner, and Qiskit.org teams in support of announcements, events, product updates, and growing brand awareness of IBM Quantum as the leader in quantum computing.
Must have excellent storytelling skills and ability to translate complex content into compelling and high-quality social media deliverables.
Connect with technical subject matter experts and developer advocates to better understand our audiences, product, and offerings to craft messaging. Understand the voice and behaviors of business, research, technical, and developer communities.
Develop the overall approach to social and govern the overall health and lead growth of existing and new IBM Quantum communities. Uncover data driven insights about targeting audiences and effectively engage them through unique strategies for each channel based on audience behaviors and platform capabilities. Responsible for social media metrics and reporting with Sprinklr; ability to measure impact of organic and paid campaigns.
Have an understanding of optimal posting cadence, best performing content types, seasonal implications, and proactive/reactive strategies. Maintain an editorial calendar in sync with the Content team in support of our key narratives and messaging.
Nourish the digital voices of individuals within and outside of IBM Quantum. Offer best practices on how to build eminence around one's social brand and be an authentic & authoritative voice in quantum computing.
Coordinate and bring forth opportunities to highlight quantum with the IBM master brand and other IBM businesses.

Preferred Work locations: NYC, NY area or Austin, TX

bhm2020


Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Social media expert and knowledge of social media trends
5+ years of experience in similar roles (B2B, emerging technology, developer marketing)
Proficiency with Sprinklr and related social media reporting and listening tools
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
Experience working beyond core social platforms (e.g., Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram) to technical discussions happening on StackExchange, Reddit, Discord etc.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and comfortable working as a self-starter
Building and growing technical communities from scratch
Ability to connect social into broader content and digital marketing strategies
Enjoy learning about complex technical products


About Business Unit
IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:

12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.

Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
